name: Pansage
flavorText: This Pokemon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Simisage
flavorText: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
Attack1Text: If this Pokemon has any Fire Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Sewaddle
flavorText: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Sewaddle
flavorText: This Pokemon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

name: Swadloon
flavorText: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

name: Swadloon
flavorText: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
Attack1Text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Leavanny
flavorText: Upon finding a small Pokemon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your Pokemon. Search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokemon and put it onto that Pokemon. (This counts as evolving that Pokemon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

name: Leavanny
flavorText: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

name: Cottonee
flavorText: They go wherever the wind takes them. On rainy days, their bodies are heavier, so they take shelter beneath big trees.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Cottonee
flavorText: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokemon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Whimsicott
flavorText: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokemon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokemon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Whimsicott
flavorText: Riding whirlwinds, they appear. These Pokemon sneak through gaps into houses and cause all sorts of mischief.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokemon can only use that attack.
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Petilil
flavorText: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Lilligant
flavorText: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokemon is popular with celebrities.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Deerling
flavorText: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokemon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Sawsbuck
flavorText: The plants growing on its horns change according to the season. The leaders of the herd possess magnificent horns.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon does 20 damage to itself.

name: Virizion
flavorText: This Pokemon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.
Attack1Text: Heal from this Pokemon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Sacred Sword during your next turn.

name: Pansear
flavorText: This Pokemon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600ยบ F.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Simisear
flavorText: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.
Attack1Text: If this Pokemon has any Water Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokemon.

name: Darumaka
flavorText: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.

name: Darmanitan
flavorText: Its internal fire burns at 2,500ยบ F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Panpour
flavorText: It does not thrive in dry environments. It keeps itself damp by shooting water stored in its head tuft from its tail.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Simipour
flavorText: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.
Attack1Text: If this Pokemon has any Grass Energy attached to it, heal 20 damage from this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Move an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon.

name: Basculin
flavorText: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they'll start fighting instantly. These Pokemon are very hostile.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this Pokemon does 80 damage to itself.

name: Basculin
flavorText: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Ducklett
flavorText: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
Attack1Text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokemon. This Pokemon can't retreat during your next turn.

name: Swanna
flavorText: It administers sharp, powerful pecks with its bill. It whips its long neck to deliver forceful repeated strikes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokemon.

name: Cubchoo
flavorText: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokemon. This Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Cubchoo
flavorText: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.

name: Beartic
flavorText: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Beartic
flavorText: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokemon does 20 damage to itself.

name: Emolga
flavorText: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membranes and released while it is gliding.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Joltik
flavorText: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.

name: Galvantula
flavorText: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Thundurus
flavorText: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokemon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokemon.

name: Woobat
flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Swoobat
flavorText: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Venipede
flavorText: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Whirlipede
flavorText: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is Poisoned, this attack does 60 more damage.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Scolipede
flavorText: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Sigilyph
flavorText: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokemon by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Sigilyph
flavorText: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokemon.

name: Gothita
flavorText: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Gothita
flavorText: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokemon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

name: Gothorita
flavorText: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokemon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Gothorita
flavorText: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.

name: Gothitelle
flavorText: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand.
Attack1Text: Does 20 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokemon.

name: Gothitelle
flavorText: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused. If tails, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Roggenrola
flavorText: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokemon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokemon if that damage is 40 or less.

name: Roggenrola
flavorText: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon does 10 damage to itself.

name: Boldore
flavorText: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon has Fighting Resistance, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Boldore
flavorText: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokemon does 20 damage to itself.

name: Gigalith
flavorText: The solar energy absorbed by its body's orange crystals is magnified internally and fired from its mouth.
Attack1Text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Fighting Energy cards, attach them to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Does 20 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to this Pokemon.

name: Drilbur
flavorText: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, each of this Pokemon's attacks does 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Drilbur
flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

name: Excadrill
flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Excadrill
flavorText: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Throh
flavorText: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Sawk
flavorText: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.
Attack1Text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. This Pokemon can't attack during your next turn.

name: Sandile
flavorText: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

name: Krokorok
flavorText: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Krookodile
flavorText: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, you may flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokemon does 20 damage to itself.

name: Terrakion
flavorText: This Pokemon came to the defense of Pokemon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Sacred Sword during your next turn.

name: Purrloin
flavorText: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

name: Liepard
flavorText: These Pokemon vanish and appear unexpectedly. Many Trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur.
Attack1Text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokemon.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Zorua
flavorText: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

name: Zoroark
flavorText: Bonds between these Pokemon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Vullaby
flavorText: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokemon.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokemon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Mandibuzz
flavorText: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokemon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Does 10 more damage for each Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokemon.

name: Ferroseed
flavorText: They stick their spikes into cave walls and absorb the minerals they find in the rock.
Attack1Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Ferroseed
flavorText: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.

name: Ferrothorn
flavorText: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. Then, your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.

name: Ferrothorn
flavorText: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage for each Energy attached to this Pokemon to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Klink
flavorText: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Klang
flavorText: Spinning minigears are rotated at high speed and repeatedly fired away. It is dangerous if the gears don't return.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokemon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Klinklang
flavorText: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.
Attack1Text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokemon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

name: Cobalion
flavorText: This legendary Pokemon battled against humans to protect Pokemon. Its personality is calm and composed.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokemon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Sacred Sword during your next turn.

name: Patrat
flavorText: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Watchog
flavorText: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck and put them back on top of his or her deck in any order.
Attack2Text: Before doing damage, you may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Pidove
flavorText: Each follows its Trainer's orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

name: Tranquill
flavorText: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Unfezant
flavorText: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves fell close to anyone other than their Trainers.
Attack1Text: Attach an Energy from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokemon.

name: Audino
flavorText: Its auditory sense is astounding. It has a radar-like ability to understand its surrounding through slight sounds.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokemon. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Heal 50 damage from 1 of your Pokemon.

name: Minccino
flavorText: These Pokemon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Cinccino
flavorText: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
Attack1Text: Switch the Defending Pokemon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Rufflet
flavorText: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.

name: Rufflet
flavorText: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Braviary
flavorText: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon does 30 damage to itself.

name: Tornadus
flavorText: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokemon to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Move a basic Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Thundurus
flavorText: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokemon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokemon.

name: Tornadus
flavorText: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokemon to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Move a basic Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
